Parents/Guardians:

The USDA has announced that they have extended the summer meal program waiver. This is great news, as this allows Forest Park Schools to continue serving free meals (as they did in the summer) to all children through as late as December 31, 2020 (or until available funding runs out). What does this mean? This means that if your child would like breakfast or lunch each day, it is free. There is no additional paperwork needed. Your child simply scans their lunch card, so that we can record the sale, and their lunch account is not charged. This is available to ALL students.

Students who choose a la carte items (additional food), or an additional milk, must pay for the additional items, and their lunch account will be charged accordingly. Students who bring cold lunch can also purchase additional food items or milk at regular cost.

Any money that has already been deposited on a student's account will remain in the student's account until needed at a later date. Please contact the office with any questions.

post_text: We are in the process of finalizing our Safe Return to School Plans. The plan will be approved and rolled out to families soon. However, we feel there is important information regarding facial coverings that we should share with families as soon as possible so you can be informed and prepared. Our plan includes various levels of PPE requirements. All staff and students will be required to wear facial coverings on buses, in hallways, and in common areas. Requirements for wearing facial coverings in the classroom will vary by grade level and the current phase plan we are following. Please plan and practice mask wearing with your children. Each student will be supplied with 3 cloth masks, as shown, or they may wear home-made or disposable masks brought from home. We have ordered youth and adult sizes to ensure that masks fit properly and are comfortable. Students will receive their masks on the first day of school if they return for face to face learning. Thank you for partnering with us to help keep your children and our staff safe.

Last night was scheduled to be the Forest Park Music Department spring concert. It is our tradition to announce the recipient of the Arion award at this concert. The Arion award goes to a senior who has shown great musicianship and citizenship and has demonstrated that they uphold the highest standards of Forest Park tradition.
It is with great pride that I announce that Ms. Mindy McKinnon is this year's recipient.

Mindy McKinnon has always loved music since she was young. She began playing the flute in fifth grade and she has improved her musical ability over the years. She has participated in Solo & Ensemble for four years and the District XIV Honors Band for two years. At Solo & Ensemble, she has received high rankings in her high school years. For her senior year, she was voted among her peers to be Drum Major for marching band. After graduating, she still plans to keep music as a part of her life.
Congratulations Mindy!

In honor of April being Poetry Month, here is a Poem Written By An Anonymous FP Student

People Talk.
They say stuff like,
‚ÄúThis must be a dream come true!‚Äù
And
‚ÄúI bet you're happy there's no more school!‚Äù
But I‚Äôm not happy
And this isn't a dream come true
I‚Äôm both sad and mad
Both equally true.
I thought this was just a little virus
And wouldn‚Äôt affect me nor you
This is far from my dream,
My dream is to just go back to school
To see my friends and talk nonsense like,
‚ÄúWho kissed you?‚Äù

Kindergarten and GSRP(4 Year-old program) registration for the 2020-21 school year will be held February 25, 26, and 27. Parents may come to the elementary office to register their child. Registration times are 8-12:30 and 1:30-3:30. On Wednesday, February 26, we will have extended hours from 3:30-5:30.

To enroll in the GSRP(4 Year-old program), a child must be 4 years old and to enter Kindergarten, a child must be 5 years old by September 1, 2020.
